intro: Podosorus angustatus, commonly known as the narrowleaf podosorus, is a species of flowering plant in the family Polygonaceae. It is characterized by its slender, lance-shaped leaves that are typically arranged alternately along the stem. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are usually greenish or reddish in color. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in woodland areas or along stream banks. Its botanical features make it a distinctive member of the buckwheat family.
